info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 03 at 5:07PM CDT until June 03 at 5:45PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CADDO AND SOUTHWESTERN BOSSIER PARISHES... At 506 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Shreveport, and is nearly stationary. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 5 pm, nickel size hail continued to fall at the National Weather Service office in Shreveport, and briefly covered the ground. A 58 mph wind gust was also measured at the Shreveport Regional Airport. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Greenwood, Fosters, Ferguson, Cross Lake, Forbing, Sligo and Barksdale Air Force Base. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This storm is producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. This storm is producing wind damage across the city of Shreveport, with multiple trees and power lines downed. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
